alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 7:37PM CST until February 19 at 7:26PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting White and Wayne Counties. Little Wabash River at Carmi affecting White, Wayne and Gallatin Counties. .Heavy rainfall, between two and two and a half inches, is forecast to cover most of the Little Wabash River and Skillet Fork River basins from shortly after midnight tonight through Thursday evening. This will cause sharp rises on the Little Wabash River and the Skillet Fork River during the next couple of days. For the Little Wabash River...including Carmi...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 19.4 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
